intro: Pfeifferago spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaved pfeifferago, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink, typically blooming in late spring. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered a conservation concern.
